So, if you are reading this, spoiler-alert: It's quite a long text.

I really like the game, I really do... It's a great idea, with lots and lots of cool characters (and I'm not just talking about Michael Myers and the other slasher-legends). I love being the killer in-game, striking fear in the hearts of many innocent and unknowing survivors. The controls are simple for both survivors and killers, graphics are not the best, but you should look past that. If you are a fan of slashers, then this really is the game for you.

But:
As a killer, I feel like most of the players I encounter are just messing arround, bodyblocking you from hanging someone on a hook, almost dancing in your vicinity (they would if they could). They are not afraid of you, while they should be... I noticed this mostly while playing as the hillbilly or the nurse. People just running around you, not even trying to dodge your hits. This makes the game really frustrating, because as a killer you really want to feel like a hunter, as a survivor you should really need to feel hunted. 

For instance: The nurse has a move called a "lethal blink strike"(those who don't know, it's a teleport attack), the thing is that it's not at all lethal. It still takes 2 hits to down a survivor!! And if you hit them with it, you enter a state of fatigue, granting them more than enough time to run towards the others. Yeah part of the game, to give survivors a fighting chance... Thing is, don't they allready get enough chances? You can heal eachother as many times as you like, you can unhook the hooked players (3 times) and you can use some objects to stop the killer from even dragging someone to a hook. 

Of course you can't help trolls being trolls, idiots from being idiots, lazy people from being lazy, etc. but sometimes it just gets too damn much...

I really love this game though and probably will continue to play it, as I have now.

I rate this game 7/10
(if you can, add Jason Voorhees!!!)

Completely stupid game. You play as a beginner with rank17 and 2 perks level 1 against 4 guys rank15 with 4 perks level 3. They have fully equipped flashlight and flashing you if you try to pick someone up. Nice mechanic. The hitboxes are shitty, you are in front of him and attacking and for some reason the enemy dont get hit. And an survivor can easily run in circles for example on a stone. You cant do anything. And with killers like the hunter, where you are very slow, you have no chance. That is what I call fair. And when survivors running in circles on a stone you have no chance to hit the enemy with your flying axe. Completely bullshit, full of bugs and unfair.

Oh and I forget the shitty DLCs. All DLCs are of course more expensive than the game itself. And DLCs include Killers for the game. And some Killers there are extremely powerful. So it's kinda pay2win. That's a pretty good idea for a competetive game that should be balanced between both sides.

Joking aside, recommended for casual play NEVER go hardcore on this one. THIS IS NOT A COMPETITIVE GAME, it's all a screen.

I personally think all the problems from the game derive from the fact the core mechanic/gameplay is too simple, so there's no room for making any big changes. I guess you can tell because the devs keep trying to "fix" it by just messing with numbers. This needs a huge, if not full rework, you know, rethink the game as a whole. The current recipe its just not cutting it. "Do 5 gens, open door, get out. Killer finds you run in circles drop pallets" That's pretty much it, and since the game comes down pretty much to the chase, you can't really add killers with interesting mechanics, because they automatically are low tier if their power doesn't directly help them in the chase.
A few layers of complexity are needed, because of the simplicity of the game (everything comes down to the chase), a lot of the current mechanics aren't even used/relevant anymore; like stealth. Then there's all the items/perks that in combination pretty much gives you god mode, like bringing 4 bnp, or having infinite evil within 3, or 1 shot hatches, you know, things that trivialize the game objectives; to me that tells me all these things were added by paper, never tested in a practical scenario.
I think it's a pretty big red flag, when half the "mechanics" of your game are in there JUST to prevent exploits (this is an online game, is nothing new, they should have known that ppl would find those holes and exploit them), like the hooks regenerating after being sabotaged, the windows getting blocked, being able to unhook from any angle, blood lust, etc; all those things don't even blend into the game, there are just there to address problems the devs didn't foresee; which tells you they weren't ready for making a game like this, which is understandable, all asimetric games so far were true vs, as in each party could eliminate the other, not like in this one, where one side's goal is to eliminate, and the other's goal is to escape. But, seems so far they are pretty proud or something for whatever they have made, and they are just trying to keep the boat afloat so they can fund the next game (note the recently added micro-transactions).

This game would benefit a ton if it had servers and didn't rely on the internet connection of the killer. Proximity voice chat for the survivors would benefit the game, but make it unable to understand as the killer so that you don't get flamed from toxic survivors. All the "good" killers cost money and the dev team doesn't seem to know how to balance the game. The game is actually enjoyable and I do enjoy the thrill of running from the killer and working as a team to try and escape together the flaws of this game are really noticable. I'm not a high ranking player and I'm not that great at the game, but I don't need to be good at the game to understand that it has huge flaws.
